name: Instant Pot® Black Beans
author: LauraF
summary: You can use your pressure cooker to cook dried black beans from scratch in under an hour (way faster than soaking them overnight and cooking them on the stove!) And, you can skip buying them canned. If you do decide to soak, check your appliance manual because cooking time will be even shorter.
directions: Pour beans into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Cover with a few inches of cool water
Select Manual; set timer for 21 minutes on high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
